page.title: 01GREWELTHORPE/KIRKBY MALZEARD
page.content: Situated to the East of the Pennines and overlooking the{VALE OF YORK,}this area of rolling farmland lies 6miles NW of the historic city of{RIPON.}From rough pasture at 800ft in the West,the land drops eastwards to 450ft across grassland drained by becks and gills flowing on to the rivers{URE & LAVER} This scene of isolated farms, small fields,winding lanes and pockets of woodland focuses on 2 villages:{KIRKBY {MALZEARD}is the larger, named from Norman French for 'church in the bad clearing/wood' It is a linear village with towered church, market cross and wide main street. 1 mile away is{ {GREWELTHORPE}a'green'village with pond and ducks.The Danish'thorpe'(secondary settlement)suggests an offshoot of Kirkby,and the'grewel'may refer to a ridge of gravel here, or to a fine flour once milled locally.
